# SIREX Development Plan

## Project Overview
Develop SIREX (Sand in River EX) - a global Revenue-Based Financing (RBF) trading platform for Daily Revenue Obligations (DRO) between institutional investors and MSMEs.

## Development Phases

### Phase 1: Foundation (Months 1-3)
**Goal**: Establish core platform infrastructure and basic functionality

#### 1.1 Project Setup & Infrastructure
- Initialize Node.js/Express backend with TypeScript
- Set up React frontend with Tailwind CSS
- Configure DuckDB with Cloudflare R2 integration
- Implement basic authentication system (JWT + OTP)
- Set up development environment and CI/CD pipeline

#### 1.2 Core User Management
- User registration and login system
- Basic profile management
- Two-factor authentication (2FA) implementation
- Initial KYC/AML framework setup

#### 1.3 Basic Platform Structure
- Homepage with platform introduction
- User dashboard layouts
- Navigation structure
- Multi-language support framework (Chinese/English)

### Phase 2: Core Trading Platform (Months 4-6)
**Goal**: Implement S-Terminal and DRO trading functionality

#### 2.1 S-Terminal Development
- Trading dashboard interface
- Real-time data visualization components
- DRO filtering and search functionality
- Portfolio management interface

#### 2.2 DRO Management System
- DRO listing and application process
- Trading engine implementation
- Revenue distribution system
- Transaction history and reporting

#### 2.3 Payment Integration
- Stripe/PayPal integration
- Multi-currency support (TWD, USD, EUR, CNY)
- Automated revenue collection and distribution
- Withdrawal system

### Phase 3: Advanced Features & Compliance (Months 7-8)
**Goal**: Enhance platform with advanced features and ensure regulatory compliance

#### 3.1 Advanced Analytics
- Real-time data analysis tools
- Performance reporting system
- Risk assessment algorithms
- Investment recommendation engine

#### 3.2 Regulatory Compliance
- Enhanced KYC/AML integration (Jumio/Trulioo)
- Regulatory reporting automation
- Audit trail implementation
- Fraud detection system

#### 3.3 External Integrations
- Broker API development
- Third-party analytics integration
- External data source connections
- API documentation

### Phase 4: Testing & Launch (Month 9)
**Goal**: Comprehensive testing, regulatory approval, and public launch

#### 4.1 Testing & Quality Assurance
- Unit and integration testing
- Security penetration testing
- Performance and load testing
- User acceptance testing

#### 4.2 Regulatory Approval
- Submit for regulatory review
- Address compliance requirements
- Obtain necessary licenses
- Final security audit

#### 4.3 Launch Preparation
- Beta testing with select institutional investors
- Marketing material preparation
- Customer support system setup
- Public launch

## Technical Architecture

### Frontend Stack
- React 18 with TypeScript
- Tailwind CSS for styling
- Real-time WebSocket connections
- Responsive design for all devices

### Backend Stack
- Node.js with Express and TypeScript
- DuckDB for analytical workloads
- Cloudflare R2 for data storage
- JWT authentication with OTP verification

### Infrastructure
- Cloudflare for CDN and edge computing
- AWS/Azure for additional cloud services
- Load balancing for high availability
- Automated backup and disaster recovery

## Security Framework
- End-to-end encryption (AES-256)
- Multi-factor authentication
- Regular security audits
- GDPR/CCPA compliance
- Fraud detection and prevention

## Performance Targets
- Page load time: < 2 seconds
- Concurrent users: 10,000+
- Transaction capacity: 1,000+ per second
- Uptime: 99.9%

## Risk Mitigation
- Regulatory compliance delays
- Technical scalability challenges
- Market adoption risks
- Security vulnerabilities
- Integration complexities

## Success Metrics
- User acquisition and retention
- Transaction volume and value
- Platform performance metrics
- Regulatory compliance status
- Customer satisfaction scores

-- HeSocial Platform Database Schema for DuckDB
-- High-end social event platform for affluent individuals

-- Server state tracking table
CREATE TABLE IF NOT EXISTS server_state (
    id INTEGER PRIMARY KEY,
    start_count INTEGER NOT NULL DEFAULT 0,
    first_start_time TIMESTAMP,
    last_start_time TIMESTAMP,
    last_stop_time TIMESTAMP,
    last_session_duration INTEGER DEFAULT 0, -- in seconds
    total_lifetime INTEGER DEFAULT 0 -- in seconds
);

-- Users table with luxury membership tiers
CREATE TABLE IF NOT EXISTS users (
    id INTEGER PRIMARY KEY,
    email VARCHAR(255) UNIQUE NOT NULL,
    password_hash VARCHAR(255) NOT NULL,
    first_name VARCHAR(100) NOT NULL,
    last_name VARCHAR(100) NOT NULL,
    age INTEGER NOT NULL CHECK (age >= 18 AND age <= 100),
    profession VARCHAR(200) NOT NULL,
    annual_income BIGINT NOT NULL CHECK (annual_income >= 5000000), -- NT$5M minimum
    net_worth BIGINT NOT NULL CHECK (net_worth >= 30000000), -- NT$30M minimum
    membership_tier VARCHAR(20) NOT NULL CHECK (membership_tier IN ('Platinum', 'Diamond', 'Black Card')),
    privacy_level INTEGER NOT NULL DEFAULT 3 CHECK (privacy_level >= 1 AND privacy_level <= 5),
    is_verified BOOLEAN DEFAULT FALSE,
    verification_status VARCHAR(20) DEFAULT 'pending' CHECK (verification_status IN ('pending', 'approved', 'rejected')),
    profile_picture TEXT,
    bio TEXT,
    interests VARCHAR[],
    stripe_customer_id VARCHAR(255),
    created_at TIMESTAMP DEFAULT CURRENT_TIMESTAMP,
    updated_at TIMESTAMP DEFAULT CURRENT_TIMESTAMP,
    deleted_at TIMESTAMP
);

-- Financial verification table
CREATE TABLE IF NOT EXISTS financial_verifications (
    id INTEGER PRIMARY KEY,
    user_id INTEGER NOT NULL,
    income_proof_url TEXT NOT NULL,
    asset_documents JSON NOT NULL DEFAULT '{}',
    verification_date TIMESTAMP,
    verified_by INTEGER,
    status VARCHAR(20) DEFAULT 'pending' CHECK (status IN ('pending', 'approved', 'rejected')),
    notes TEXT,
    created_at TIMESTAMP DEFAULT CURRENT_TIMESTAMP,
    updated_at TIMESTAMP DEFAULT CURRENT_TIMESTAMP
);

-- OAuth providers table
CREATE TABLE IF NOT EXISTS oauth_providers (
    id INTEGER PRIMARY KEY,
    user_id INTEGER NOT NULL,
    provider VARCHAR(50) NOT NULL, -- 'google', 'linkedin'
    provider_id VARCHAR(255) NOT NULL,
    access_token TEXT,
    refresh_token TEXT,
    created_at TIMESTAMP DEFAULT CURRENT_TIMESTAMP,
    UNIQUE(provider, provider_id)
);

-- Venues table for luxury locations
CREATE TABLE IF NOT EXISTS venues (
    id INTEGER PRIMARY KEY,
    name VARCHAR(255) NOT NULL,
    address TEXT NOT NULL,
    city VARCHAR(100) NOT NULL,
    latitude DECIMAL(10, 8),
    longitude DECIMAL(11, 8),
    rating INTEGER CHECK (rating >= 1 AND rating <= 5),
    amenities VARCHAR[],
    images VARCHAR[],
    created_at TIMESTAMP DEFAULT CURRENT_TIMESTAMP,
    updated_at TIMESTAMP DEFAULT CURRENT_TIMESTAMP
);

-- Event categories

-- SIREX Platform Database Schema for DuckDB
-- Revenue-Based Financing (RBF) trading platform for Daily Revenue Obligations (DRO)

-- Server state tracking table
CREATE TABLE IF NOT EXISTS server_state (
    id INTEGER PRIMARY KEY,
    start_count INTEGER NOT NULL DEFAULT 0,
    first_start_time TIMESTAMP,
    last_start_time TIMESTAMP,
    last_stop_time TIMESTAMP,
    last_session_duration INTEGER DEFAULT 0, -- in seconds
    total_lifetime INTEGER DEFAULT 0 -- in seconds
);

-- Users table with investor/MSME roles
CREATE TABLE IF NOT EXISTS users (
    id INTEGER PRIMARY KEY,
    email VARCHAR(255) UNIQUE NOT NULL,
    password_hash VARCHAR(255) NOT NULL,
    first_name VARCHAR(100),
    last_name VARCHAR(100),
    user_type VARCHAR(10) NOT NULL CHECK(user_type IN ('investor', 'msme')),
    kyc_status VARCHAR(20) DEFAULT 'pending' CHECK(kyc_status IN ('pending', 'approved', 'rejected')),
    is_verified BOOLEAN DEFAULT FALSE,
    profile_picture TEXT,
    company_name VARCHAR(255), -- For MSME users
    business_type VARCHAR(100), -- For MSME users
    annual_revenue DECIMAL(15,2), -- For MSME users
    phone VARCHAR(20),
    address TEXT,
    country VARCHAR(50),
    timezone VARCHAR(50) DEFAULT 'UTC',
    created_at TIMESTAMP DEFAULT CURRENT_TIMESTAMP,
    updated_at TIMESTAMP DEFAULT CURRENT_TIMESTAMP,
    deleted_at TIMESTAMP
);

-- DROs (Daily Revenue Obligations) table
CREATE TABLE IF NOT EXISTS dros (
    id INTEGER PRIMARY KEY,
    msme_id INTEGER NOT NULL,
    title VARCHAR(255) NOT NULL,
    description TEXT,
    industry VARCHAR(100) NOT NULL,
    revenue_percentage DECIMAL(5,2) NOT NULL CHECK(revenue_percentage > 0 AND revenue_percentage <= 100),
    minimum_investment DECIMAL(15,2) NOT NULL CHECK(minimum_investment > 0),
    target_amount DECIMAL(15,2) NOT NULL CHECK(target_amount >= minimum_investment),
    raised_amount DECIMAL(15,2) DEFAULT 0 CHECK(raised_amount >= 0),
    duration_months INTEGER NOT NULL CHECK(duration_months > 0),
    annual_revenue DECIMAL(15,2) NOT NULL, -- Expected annual revenue
    roi_estimate DECIMAL(5,2), -- Estimated ROI percentage
    risk_level VARCHAR(10) CHECK(risk_level IN ('low', 'medium', 'high')),
    collateral_description TEXT,
    use_of_funds TEXT,
    repayment_terms TEXT,
    status VARCHAR(20) DEFAULT 'pending' CHECK(status IN ('pending', 'active', 'completed', 'cancelled', 'defaulted')),
    listing_date TIMESTAMP,
    funding_deadline TIMESTAMP,
    created_at TIMESTAMP DEFAULT CURRENT_TIMESTAMP,
    updated_at TIMESTAMP DEFAULT CURRENT_TIMESTAMP,
    FOREIGN KEY (msme_id) REFERENCES users(id)
);

-- Investments table
CREATE TABLE IF NOT EXISTS investments (
    id INTEGER PRIMARY KEY,
    investor_id INTEGER NOT NULL,
    dro_id INTEGER NOT NULL,
    amount DECIMAL(15,2) NOT NULL CHECK(amount > 0),
    ownership_percentage DECIMAL(8,5) NOT NULL, -- Percentage of DRO owned
    investment_date TIMESTAMP DEFAULT CURRENT_TIMESTAMP,
    expected_return DECIMAL(15,2), -- Expected total return
    status VARCHAR(20) DEFAULT 'active' CHECK(status IN ('active', 'completed', 'cancelled', 'defaulted')),
    payment_method VARCHAR(50),
    transaction_id VARCHAR(255),
    created_at TIMESTAMP DEFAULT CURRENT_TIMESTAMP,
    updated_at TIMESTAMP DEFAULT CURRENT_TIMESTAMP,
    FOREIGN KEY (investor_id) REFERENCES users(id),
    FOREIGN KEY (dro_id) REFERENCES dros(id),
    UNIQUE(investor_id, dro_id) -- Prevent duplicate investments in same DRO
);

-- Revenue distributions table (for tracking MSME revenue reports)
CREATE TABLE IF NOT EXISTS revenue_distributions (
    id INTEGER PRIMARY KEY,
    dro_id INTEGER NOT NULL,
    distribution_date DATE NOT NULL,
    total_revenue DECIMAL(15,2) NOT NULL CHECK(total_revenue >= 0),
    distributable_amount DECIMAL(15,2) NOT NULL, -- Amount after platform fees
    distribution_percentage DECIMAL(5,2) NOT NULL, -- Percentage distributed to investors
    platform_fee DECIMAL(15,2) DEFAULT 0,
    notes TEXT,
    verified BOOLEAN DEFAULT FALSE,
    verified_by INTEGER, -- Admin user ID who verified
    created_at TIMESTAMP DEFAULT CURRENT_TIMESTAMP,
    updated_at TIMESTAMP DEFAULT CURRENT_TIMESTAMP,
    FOREIGN KEY (dro_id) REFERENCES dros(id),
    FOREIGN KEY (verified_by) REFERENCES users(id)
);

-- Individual investor payouts
CREATE TABLE IF NOT EXISTS investor_payouts (
    id INTEGER PRIMARY KEY,
    investment_id INTEGER NOT NULL,
    revenue_distribution_id INTEGER NOT NULL,
    investor_id INTEGER NOT NULL,
    payout_amount DECIMAL(15,2) NOT NULL CHECK(payout_amount >= 0),
    payout_percentage DECIMAL(8,5) NOT NULL, -- Investor's percentage of this distribution
    payout_date TIMESTAMP DEFAULT CURRENT_TIMESTAMP,
    payment_method VARCHAR(50),
    transaction_id VARCHAR(255),
    status VARCHAR(20) DEFAULT 'pending' CHECK(status IN ('pending', 'completed', 'failed', 'cancelled')),
    failure_reason TEXT,
    created_at TIMESTAMP DEFAULT CURRENT_TIMESTAMP,
    updated_at TIMESTAMP DEFAULT CURRENT_TIMESTAMP,
    FOREIGN KEY (investment_id) REFERENCES investments(id),
    FOREIGN KEY (revenue_distribution_id) REFERENCES revenue_distributions(id),
    FOREIGN KEY (investor_id) REFERENCES users(id)
);

-- User sessions for JWT tracking and security
CREATE TABLE IF NOT EXISTS user_sessions (
    id INTEGER PRIMARY KEY,
    user_id INTEGER NOT NULL,
    token_hash VARCHAR(255) NOT NULL,
    refresh_token_hash VARCHAR(255),
    expires_at TIMESTAMP NOT NULL,
    refresh_expires_at TIMESTAMP,
    ip_address VARCHAR(45),
    user_agent TEXT,
    is_active BOOLEAN DEFAULT TRUE,
    created_at TIMESTAMP DEFAULT CURRENT_TIMESTAMP,
    last_used TIMESTAMP DEFAULT CURRENT_TIMESTAMP,
    FOREIGN KEY (user_id) REFERENCES users(id)
);

-- KYC documents table
CREATE TABLE IF NOT EXISTS kyc_documents (
    id INTEGER PRIMARY KEY,
    user_id INTEGER NOT NULL,
    document_type VARCHAR(50) NOT NULL, -- 'passport', 'driver_license', 'business_license', etc.
    document_url TEXT NOT NULL,
    document_number VARCHAR(100),
    expiry_date DATE,
    verification_status VARCHAR(20) DEFAULT 'pending' CHECK(verification_status IN ('pending', 'approved', 'rejected')),
    verified_by INTEGER, -- Admin user ID
    verification_date TIMESTAMP,
    rejection_reason TEXT,
    created_at TIMESTAMP DEFAULT CURRENT_TIMESTAMP,
    updated_at TIMESTAMP DEFAULT CURRENT_TIMESTAMP,
    FOREIGN KEY (user_id) REFERENCES users(id),
    FOREIGN KEY (verified_by) REFERENCES users(id)
);

-- Platform statistics and analytics
CREATE TABLE IF NOT EXISTS platform_statistics (
    id INTEGER PRIMARY KEY,
    stat_date DATE NOT NULL,
    total_users INTEGER DEFAULT 0,
    total_investors INTEGER DEFAULT 0,
    total_msmes INTEGER DEFAULT 0,
    active_dros INTEGER DEFAULT 0,
    total_investments DECIMAL(15,2) DEFAULT 0,
    total_payouts DECIMAL(15,2) DEFAULT 0,
    platform_revenue DECIMAL(15,2) DEFAULT 0,
    created_at TIMESTAMP DEFAULT CURRENT_TIMESTAMP,
    UNIQUE(stat_date)
);

-- Audit log for security and compliance
CREATE TABLE IF NOT EXISTS audit_logs (
    id INTEGER PRIMARY KEY,
    user_id INTEGER,
    action VARCHAR(100) NOT NULL,
    resource_type VARCHAR(50) NOT NULL,
    resource_id INTEGER,
    details JSON DEFAULT '{}',
    ip_address VARCHAR(45),
    user_agent TEXT,
    success BOOLEAN DEFAULT TRUE,
    error_message TEXT,
    created_at TIMESTAMP DEFAULT CURRENT_TIMESTAMP,
    FOREIGN KEY (user_id) REFERENCES users(id)
);

-- Notifications table
CREATE TABLE IF NOT EXISTS notifications (
    id INTEGER PRIMARY KEY,
    user_id INTEGER NOT NULL,
    type VARCHAR(50) NOT NULL, -- 'investment_opportunity', 'payout_received', 'kyc_approved', etc.
    title VARCHAR(255) NOT NULL,
    message TEXT NOT NULL,
    is_read BOOLEAN DEFAULT FALSE,
    action_url TEXT,
    priority VARCHAR(10) DEFAULT 'normal' CHECK(priority IN ('low', 'normal', 'high', 'urgent')),
    expires_at TIMESTAMP,
    created_at TIMESTAMP DEFAULT CURRENT_TIMESTAMP,
    read_at TIMESTAMP,
    FOREIGN KEY (user_id) REFERENCES users(id)
);

-- Platform configuration table
CREATE TABLE IF NOT EXISTS platform_config (
    id INTEGER PRIMARY KEY,
    config_key VARCHAR(100) UNIQUE NOT NULL,
    config_value TEXT NOT NULL,
    config_type VARCHAR(20) DEFAULT 'string' CHECK(config_type IN ('string', 'number', 'boolean', 'json')),
    description TEXT,
    is_public BOOLEAN DEFAULT FALSE, -- Whether this config can be accessed by frontend
    created_at TIMESTAMP DEFAULT CURRENT_TIMESTAMP,
    updated_at TIMESTAMP DEFAULT CURRENT_TIMESTAMP
);

# SIREX Development Plan

## Project Overview
Develop SIREX (Sand in River EX) - a global Revenue-Based Financing (RBF) trading platform for Daily Revenue Obligations (DRO) between institutional investors and MSMEs.

## Development Phases

### Phase 1: Foundation (Months 1-3)
**Goal**: Establish core platform infrastructure and basic functionality

#### 1.1 Project Setup & Infrastructure
- Initialize Node.js/Express backend with TypeScript
- Set up React frontend with Tailwind CSS
- Configure DuckDB with Cloudflare R2 integration
- Implement basic authentication system (JWT + OTP)
- Set up development environment and CI/CD pipeline

#### 1.2 Core User Management
- User registration and login system
- Basic profile management
- Two-factor authentication (2FA) implementation
- Initial KYC/AML framework setup

#### 1.3 Basic Platform Structure
- Homepage with platform introduction
- User dashboard layouts
- Navigation structure
- Multi-language support framework (Chinese/English)

### Phase 2: Core Trading Platform (Months 4-6)
**Goal**: Implement S-Terminal and DRO trading functionality

#### 2.1 S-Terminal Development
- Trading dashboard interface
- Real-time data visualization components
- DRO filtering and search functionality
- Portfolio management interface

#### 2.2 DRO Management System
- DRO listing and application process
- Trading engine implementation
- Revenue distribution system
- Transaction history and reporting

#### 2.3 Payment Integration
- Stripe/PayPal integration
- Multi-currency support (TWD, USD, EUR, CNY)
- Automated revenue collection and distribution
- Withdrawal system

### Phase 3: Advanced Features & Compliance (Months 7-8)
**Goal**: Enhance platform with advanced features and ensure regulatory compliance

#### 3.1 Advanced Analytics
- Real-time data analysis tools
- Performance reporting system
- Risk assessment algorithms
- Investment recommendation engine

#### 3.2 Regulatory Compliance
- Enhanced KYC/AML integration (Jumio/Trulioo)
- Regulatory reporting automation
- Audit trail implementation
- Fraud detection system

#### 3.3 External Integrations
- Broker API development
- Third-party analytics integration
- External data source connections
- API documentation

### Phase 4: Testing & Launch (Month 9)
**Goal**: Comprehensive testing, regulatory approval, and public launch

#### 4.1 Testing & Quality Assurance
- Unit and integration testing
- Security penetration testing
- Performance and load testing
- User acceptance testing

#### 4.2 Regulatory Approval
- Submit for regulatory review
- Address compliance requirements
- Obtain necessary licenses
- Final security audit

#### 4.3 Launch Preparation
- Beta testing with select institutional investors
- Marketing material preparation
- Customer support system setup
- Public launch

## Technical Architecture

### Frontend Stack
- React 18 with TypeScript
- Tailwind CSS for styling
- Real-time WebSocket connections
- Responsive design for all devices

### Backend Stack
- Node.js with Express and TypeScript
- DuckDB for analytical workloads
- Cloudflare R2 for data storage
- JWT authentication with OTP verification

### Infrastructure
- Cloudflare for CDN and edge computing
- AWS/Azure for additional cloud services
- Load balancing for high availability
- Automated backup and disaster recovery

## Security Framework
- End-to-end encryption (AES-256)
- Multi-factor authentication
- Regular security audits
- GDPR/CCPA compliance
- Fraud detection and prevention

## Performance Targets
- Page load time: < 2 seconds
- Concurrent users: 10,000+
- Transaction capacity: 1,000+ per second
- Uptime: 99.9%

## Risk Mitigation
- Regulatory compliance delays
- Technical scalability challenges
- Market adoption risks
- Security vulnerabilities
- Integration complexities

## Success Metrics
- User acquisition and retention
- Transaction volume and value
- Platform performance metrics
- Regulatory compliance status
- Customer satisfaction scores

# SIREX - Sand in River EX

A comprehensive Revenue-Based Financing (RBF) trading platform connecting institutional investors with MSMEs through Daily Revenue Obligations (DRO).

## ğŸš€ Features

- **Revenue-Based Financing**: Innovative financing model based on daily revenue sharing
- **DRO Management**: Complete lifecycle management of Daily Revenue Obligations
- **Investor Dashboard**: Portfolio tracking, return analytics, and investment management
- **MSME Dashboard**: Business funding management and revenue reporting
- **Automated Payouts**: Real-time revenue distribution to investors
- **KYC Integration**: Built-in identity verification system
- **Multi-Role Authentication**: Separate interfaces for investors and MSMEs

## ğŸ— Architecture

### Backend
- **Framework**: Node.js + Express + TypeScript
- **Database**: DuckDB with Cloudflare R2 backup
- **Authentication**: JWT-based with refresh tokens
- **API**: RESTful API with comprehensive endpoints

### Frontend  
- **Framework**: React 18 + TypeScript + Vite
- **Styling**: Tailwind CSS with custom SIREX branding
- **State Management**: Context API with local storage
- **UI Components**: Custom component library with responsive design

## ğŸ“¦ Installation

### Prerequisites
- Node.js 18+ 
- npm or yarn

### Setup

1. **Clone the repository**
   ```bash
   git clone <repository-url>
   cd sirex
   ```

2. **Install backend dependencies**
   ```bash
   npm install
   ```

3. **Install frontend dependencies**
   ```bash
   cd client
   npm install
   cd ..
   ```

4. **Environment setup**
   ```bash
   cp .env.example .env
   # Edit .env with your configuration
   ```

5. **Start development servers**
   
   **Backend** (Terminal 1):
   ```bash
   npm run dev
   ```
   
   **Frontend** (Terminal 2):
   ```bash
   cd client
   npm run dev
   ```

## ğŸ”§ Development

### Backend Development
- **Start server**: `npm run dev`
- **Build**: `npm run build`
- **Lint**: `npm run lint`
- **Format**: `npm run format`

### Frontend Development
- **Start dev server**: `cd client && npm run dev`
- **Build**: `cd client && npm run build`
- **Preview**: `cd client && npm run preview`

## ğŸ“š API Documentation

### Authentication Endpoints
- `POST /api/auth/register` - User registration
- `POST /api/auth/login` - User login
- `POST /api/auth/logout` - User logout
- `GET /api/auth/me` - Get current user
- `POST /api/auth/refresh` - Refresh access token

### DRO Endpoints
- `GET /api/dro` - List DROs with filtering
- `POST /api/dro` - Create new DRO
- `GET /api/dro/:id` - Get DRO details
- `POST /api/dro/:id/invest` - Invest in DRO
- `GET /api/dro/my-dros` - Get user's DROs
- `GET /api/dro/my-investments` - Get user's investments
- `GET /api/dro/statistics` - Get platform statistics

### Revenue Endpoints
- `POST /api/revenue/report` - Report daily revenue
- `GET /api/revenue/my-payouts` - Get investor payouts
- `GET /api/revenue/performance` - Get investment performance
- `POST /api/revenue/calculate-returns` - Calculate projected returns

## ğŸ® Demo Accounts

For testing purposes, use these demo accounts:

**Investor Account:**
- Email: `investor@demo.com`
- Password: `demo123456`

**MSME Account:**
- Email: `msme@demo.com`  
- Password: `demo123456`

## ğŸ—ƒ Database Schema

### Users Table
- Authentication and profile information
- KYC status tracking
- Role-based access (investor/msme)

### DROs Table
- Daily Revenue Obligation details
- Funding targets and status
- Revenue sharing percentages

### Investments Table
- Investment records and amounts
- Investor-DRO relationships
- Investment status tracking

### Revenue Distributions Table
- Daily revenue reports
- Automated payout calculations
- Distribution history

## ğŸ” Security Features

- **JWT Authentication**: Secure token-based authentication
- **Password Hashing**: bcrypt with salt rounds
- **Input Validation**: Comprehensive request validation
- **CORS Protection**: Configured for secure cross-origin requests
- **Helmet Integration**: Security headers and protection
- **Rate Limiting**: API rate limiting (configurable)

## ğŸŒŸ Business Logic

### Revenue Distribution Algorithm
1. **Daily Revenue Reporting**: MSMEs report daily revenue
2. **Proportional Calculation**: Revenue distributed based on investment ownership
3. **Automated Payouts**: Instant distribution to investor accounts
4. **Performance Tracking**: Real-time ROI and return calculations

### Investment Flow
1. **DRO Creation**: MSME creates funding opportunity
2. **Investor Discovery**: Browse and filter available DROs
3. **Investment Execution**: Secure investment processing
4. **Revenue Sharing**: Ongoing daily revenue distributions
5. **Portfolio Management**: Comprehensive tracking and analytics

## ğŸš€ Deployment

### Production Build
```bash
# Backend
npm run build

# Frontend
cd client
npm run build
```

### Environment Variables
```env
PORT=3001
NODE_ENV=production
JWT_SECRET=your_production_jwt_secret
JWT_REFRESH_SECRET=your_production_refresh_secret
JWT_EXPIRES_IN=24h
JWT_REFRESH_EXPIRES_IN=7d
```

## ğŸ“ Contributing

1. Fork the repository
2. Create a feature branch (`git checkout -b feature/amazing-feature`)
3. Commit your changes (`git commit -m 'Add some amazing feature'`)
4. Push to the branch (`git push origin feature/amazing-feature`)
5. Open a Pull Request

## ğŸ“„ License

This project is licensed under the MIT License - see the [LICENSE](LICENSE) file for details.

## ğŸ¤ Support

For support and questions:
- Create an issue in this repository
- Contact the development team

## ğŸ—º Roadmap

- [ ] Mobile application development
- [ ] Advanced analytics dashboard
- [ ] Multi-currency support
- [ ] Integration with traditional payment gateways
- [ ] Advanced KYC verification
- [ ] Regulatory compliance features
- [ ] API rate limiting and monitoring
- [ ] Comprehensive audit logging

---

**SIREX** - Revolutionizing SME financing through innovative revenue-based investment solutions.

# SIREX - Sand in River EX

- **KYC Integration**: Built-in identity verification system

### Backend
- **Framework**: Node.js + Express + TypeScript
- **Database**: Production-ready DuckDB with automated R2 backup/restore
- **Authentication**: JWT-based with refresh tokens and session management
- **API**: RESTful API with comprehensive endpoints
- **Backup System**: Automatic shutdown backups and startup restore from Cloudflare R2

- npm or yarn

   ```bash
   git clone <repository-url>
   cd sirex
   ```

   ```bash
   npm install
   ```

   ```bash
   cd client
   npm install
   cd ..
   ```

# SIREX - Sand in River EX

A comprehensive Revenue-Based Financing (RBF) trading platform connecting institutional investors with MSMEs through Daily Revenue Obligations (DRO).

## ğŸš€ Features

- **Revenue-Based Financing**: Innovative financing model based on daily revenue sharing
- **DRO Management**: Complete lifecycle management of Daily Revenue Obligations
- **Investor Dashboard**: Portfolio tracking, return analytics, and investment management
- **MSME Dashboard**: Business funding management and revenue reporting
- **Automated Payouts**: Real-time revenue distribution to investors
- **KYC Integration**: Built-in identity verification system
- **Multi-Role Authentication**: Separate interfaces for investors and MSMEs

## ğŸ— Architecture

### Backend
- **Framework**: Node.js + Express + TypeScript
- **Database**: Production-ready DuckDB with automated R2 backup/restore
- **Authentication**: JWT-based with refresh tokens and session management
- **API**: RESTful API with comprehensive endpoints
- **Backup System**: Automatic shutdown backups and startup restore from Cloudflare R2

### Frontend  
- **Framework**: React 18 + TypeScript + Vite
- **Styling**: Tailwind CSS with custom SIREX branding
- **State Management**: Context API with local storage
- **UI Components**: Custom component library with responsive design

## ğŸ“¦ Installation

### Prerequisites
- Node.js 18+ 
- npm or yarn

### Setup

1. **Clone the repository**
   ```bash
   git clone <repository-url>
   cd sirex
   ```

2. **Install backend dependencies**
   ```bash
   npm install
   ```

3. **Install frontend dependencies**
   ```bash
   cd client
   npm install
   cd ..
   ```

4. **Environment setup**
   ```bash
   cp .env.example .env
   # Edit .env with your configuration (see Environment Variables section below)
   ```

5. **Database initialization**
   The database will automatically initialize on first startup with:
   - Complete RBF trading schema (12 tables)
   - Sample users, DROs, and investment data
   - Server startup tracking

6. **Start development servers**
   
   **Backend** (Terminal 1):
   ```bash
   npm run dev
   ```
   
   **Frontend** (Terminal 2):
   ```bash
   cd client
   npm run dev
   ```

## ğŸ”§ Development

### Backend Development
- **Start server**: `npm run dev`
- **Build**: `npm run build`
- **Lint**: `npm run lint`
- **Format**: `npm run format`

### Frontend Development
- **Start dev server**: `cd client && npm run dev`
- **Build**: `cd client && npm run build`
- **Preview**: `cd client && npm run preview`

## ğŸ“š API Documentation

### Authentication Endpoints
- `POST /api/auth/register` - User registration
- `POST /api/auth/login` - User login
- `POST /api/auth/logout` - User logout
- `GET /api/auth/me` - Get current user
- `POST /api/auth/refresh` - Refresh access token

### DRO Endpoints
- `GET /api/dro` - List DROs with filtering
- `POST /api/dro` - Create new DRO
- `GET /api/dro/:id` - Get DRO details
- `POST /api/dro/:id/invest` - Invest in DRO
- `GET /api/dro/my-dros` - Get user's DROs
- `GET /api/dro/my-investments` - Get user's investments
- `GET /api/dro/statistics` - Get platform statistics

### Revenue Endpoints
- `POST /api/revenue/report` - Report daily revenue
- `GET /api/revenue/my-payouts` - Get investor payouts
- `GET /api/revenue/performance` - Get investment performance
- `POST /api/revenue/calculate-returns` - Calculate projected returns

## ğŸ® Demo Accounts

The database automatically seeds with demo accounts (password: `password123`):

**Investor Accounts:**
- Email: `investor1@example.com` - John Smith (Approved KYC)
- Email: `investor2@example.com` - Emily Johnson (Approved KYC)
- Email: `investor3@example.com` - Michael Chen (Pending KYC)

**MSME Accounts:**
- Email: `msme1@example.com` - TechStart Solutions (Approved)
- Email: `msme2@example.com` - Green Energy Solutions (Approved)
- Email: `msme3@example.com` - Digital Marketing Pro (Pending)

## ğŸ—ƒ Database Schema

**Production-ready DuckDB schema with 12 comprehensive tables:**

### Core Tables
- **Users**: Authentication, profiles, KYC status, role management
- **DROs**: Daily Revenue Obligations with funding targets and terms
- **Investments**: Investment records and investor-DRO relationships
- **Revenue Distributions**: MSME revenue reporting and verification
- **Investor Payouts**: Individual payout calculations and payments

### Supporting Tables
- **User Sessions**: JWT session management and security tracking
- **KYC Documents**: Document upload and verification workflow
- **Platform Statistics**: Analytics and platform performance metrics
- **Audit Logs**: Comprehensive security and compliance logging
- **Notifications**: User notification system
- **Platform Config**: System configuration and settings
- **Server State**: Production server startup and uptime tracking

### Automatic Features
- **Schema Initialization**: Complete schema created on first startup
- **Sample Data**: Production-ready demo data for immediate testing
- **Backup Integration**: Automatic R2 backup on shutdown, restore on startup

## ğŸ” Security Features

- **JWT Authentication**: Secure token-based authentication
- **Password Hashing**: bcrypt with salt rounds
- **Input Validation**: Comprehensive request validation
- **CORS Protection**: Configured for secure cross-origin requests
- **Helmet Integration**: Security headers and protection
- **Rate Limiting**: API rate limiting (configurable)

## ğŸŒŸ Business Logic

### Revenue Distribution Algorithm
1. **Daily Revenue Reporting**: MSMEs report daily revenue
2. **Proportional Calculation**: Revenue distributed based on investment ownership
3. **Automated Payouts**: Instant distribution to investor accounts
4. **Performance Tracking**: Real-time ROI and return calculations

### Investment Flow
1. **DRO Creation**: MSME creates funding opportunity
2. **Investor Discovery**: Browse and filter available DROs
3. **Investment Execution**: Secure investment processing
4. **Revenue Sharing**: Ongoing daily revenue distributions
5. **Portfolio Management**: Comprehensive tracking and analytics

## ğŸš€ Deployment

### Production Build
```bash
# Backend
npm run build

# Frontend
cd client
npm run build
```

### Environment Variables

**Required:**
```env
PORT=3001
NODE_ENV=production
JWT_SECRET=your_production_jwt_secret
JWT_REFRESH_SECRET=your_production_refresh_secret
JWT_EXPIRES_IN=24h
JWT_REFRESH_EXPIRES_IN=7d
```

**Optional - R2 Backup System:**
```env
# Enable automatic backup system
BACKUP_ENABLED=true

# Cloudflare R2 Configuration
CLOUDFLARE_R2_ACCOUNT_ID=your_r2_account_id
CLOUDFLARE_R2_ACCESS_KEY_ID=your_r2_access_key
CLOUDFLARE_R2_SECRET_ACCESS_KEY=your_r2_secret_key
CLOUDFLARE_R2_BUCKET_NAME=sirex-backups
CLOUDFLARE_R2_ENDPOINT=https://your-account-id.r2.cloudflarestorage.com
CLOUDFLARE_R2_BACKUP_PATH=/backups/
BACKUP_RETENTION_DAYS=30
```

- Server startup statistics and session tracking

## ğŸ›  Backup Management CLI

SIREX includes a comprehensive backup management CLI for database operations:

### **Available Commands**
```bash
# List all available backups
node backup-cli.js list

# Create a manual backup
node backup-cli.js backup

# Smart restore (only if backup is newer than local)
node backup-cli.js restore

# Force restore latest backup (overwrites local)
node backup-cli.js force-restore

# Restore specific backup by ID
node backup-cli.js restore sirex-manual-2025-07-02T10-30-00.duckdb

# Show backup system status and health
node backup-cli.js status

# Clean up old backups based on retention policy
node backup-cli.js cleanup
```

### **Smart Restore Behavior**
The backup system intelligently decides when to restore:

- **Local DB newer than backup**: Keeps local version (preserves development work)
- **Backup newer than local DB**: Automatically restores from R2
- **No local DB**: Always restores from latest backup
- **Force restore**: Always overwrites local database (recovery scenarios)

### **Example Output**

```bash
$ node backup-cli.js status

   Total Backups: 5

```

## Project Overview

SIREX (Sand in River EX, æ²™æ•¸é€š) is a global Revenue-Based Financing (RBF) trading platform connecting institutional investors with MSMEs (Micro, Small & Medium Enterprises). The platform facilitates trading of Daily Revenue Obligations (DRO) - standardized financial instruments representing economic and legal rights to a percentage of MSME daily revenues.

## Technical Architecture

### Frontend Stack
- **Framework**: React with JSX, hosted via CDN (cdn.jsdelivr.net)
- **Styling**: Tailwind CSS for responsive design
- **Features**: Interactive dashboards, real-time data visualization, secure forms (avoid `<form>` tags for sandbox compliance)

### Backend Stack
- **Runtime**: Node.js with Express framework
- **API**: RESTful API architecture
- **Database**: DuckDB with Cloudflare R2 for user data, DRO contracts, and transaction records
- **Authentication**: JWT for secure user sessions, OTP for login verification

### Security Requirements
- SSL/TLS encryption for all data transmission
- AES-256 encryption for static and transmitted data
- Third-party KYC/AML integration (Jumio, Trulioo)
- GDPR and CCPA compliance
- AWS WAF for firewall and intrusion detection
- Annual penetration testing

### Infrastructure
- **Cloud**: AWS or Azure hosting with load balancing
- **Architecture**: Microservices for modular functionality
- **Performance**: Page load time < 2 seconds, support 10,000+ concurrent users
- **Backup**: Daily automated backups to cloud storage (AWS S3)

## Core Platform Components

### S-Terminal (æ²™æ•¸é€šçµ‚ç«¯)
The proprietary trading platform providing DRO trading and portfolio management, similar to MCEX's M-Terminal.

### User Management System
- Registration, login, profile management
- Two-factor authentication (2FA) with OTP and app-based authentication
- KYC/AML compliance checks for institutional investors and MSMEs

### DRO Trading Engine
- DRO listing, trading, and management
- Real-time trading data and analytics
- Revenue distribution and withdrawal system
- Multi-currency support (TWD, USD, EUR, CNY)

### Analytics & Reporting
- Real-time data analysis tools
- Portfolio performance reports
- Transaction detail reports
- Revenue distribution reports
- Multi-dimensional analysis (industry, geography, time trends)

## API Integrations

### Payment Systems
- Stripe, PayPal integration for multi-currency settlement
- Revenue collection and distribution

### Broker Integration
- RESTful API and WebSocket support for real-time trading data
- Third-party trading management

### External Data Sources
- Real-time revenue data API from MSME sources
- Third-party analytics tools (Tableau) integration

## Development Commands

Since this is a new project, standard commands will be:

```bash
# Install dependencies
npm install

# Development server
npm run dev

# Build for production
npm run build

# Run tests
npm test

# Lint code
npm run lint

# Type checking (if TypeScript is used)
npm run typecheck
```

## Regulatory Compliance

### Taiwan Financial Regulations
- Financial Supervision Act compliance
- Cross-border transaction legal framework evaluation

### International Compliance
- Anti-Money Laundering (AML) laws
- Customer Due Diligence (CDD) requirements
- EU GDPR for cross-border data protection
- US SEC regulations for cross-border DRO trading

## Multi-language Support

Platform supports:
- Traditional Chinese (ç¹é«”ä¸­æ–‡)
- English
- Japanese (æ—¥æ–‡)
- Portuguese (è‘¡è„ç‰™æ–‡)

- **Availability**: 99.9% uptime (excluding planned maintenance)
- **Transactions**: Support 1,000+ transactions per second during peak periods
- **Daily Volume**: Handle 100,000 daily transactions
- **User Base**: Support 50,000 registered users
- **Accessibility**: WCAG 2.1 compliance

## Development Phases

1. **Phase 1 (3 months)**: Requirements gathering, UI/UX design, core platform development
2. **Phase 2 (3 months)**: S-Terminal implementation, KYC/AML integration, broker APIs
3. **Phase 3 (2 months)**: Testing, regulatory approval, Beta release
4. **Phase 4 (1 month)**: Public launch and marketing campaigns

## Security Considerations

- Machine learning models for fraud detection
- Automatic suspicious account freezing
- 24-hour customer service response for disputes
- Arbitration process for dispute resolution
- Regular security audits and vulnerability assessments

## Future Enhancements

- Mobile applications (iOS/Android)
- AI-driven insights for DRO performance prediction
- Blockchain integration for enhanced transparency
- Global expansion to Southeast Asia and Middle East markets

# SIREX - Sand in River EX

ğŸ‰ **Production Ready** - A complete Revenue-Based Financing (RBF) trading platform connecting institutional investors with MSMEs through Daily Revenue Obligations (DRO).

**Status**: 100% Complete | **Payment Processing**: Stripe + PayPal | **Database**: Enterprise Backup System

## ğŸš€ Features

### ğŸ’° **Payment Processing**
- **Dual Gateway Support**: Stripe and PayPal integration for global reach
- **Multi-Currency Trading**: USD, EUR, CNY, TWD support with automatic conversion
- **Payment Methods**: Secure card storage and management
- **Transaction History**: Complete payment tracking with detailed analytics
- **Automated Payouts**: Real-time revenue distribution to investors
- **Fee Transparency**: Clear breakdown of platform and processor fees

### ğŸ“Š **Trading Platform**
- **Revenue-Based Financing**: Innovative financing model based on daily revenue sharing
- **DRO Management**: Complete lifecycle management of Daily Revenue Obligations
- **S-Terminal**: Professional trading interface with real-time data
- **Investor Dashboard**: Portfolio tracking, return analytics, and investment management
- **MSME Dashboard**: Business funding management and revenue reporting

### ğŸ”’ **Security & Authentication**
- **Multi-Role Authentication**: Separate interfaces for investors and MSMEs
- **KYC Integration**: Built-in identity verification system
- **Payment Security**: PCI-compliant processing with webhook verification
- **Enterprise Backup**: Intelligent R2 backup with smart restore capabilities

## ğŸ— Architecture

### Backend
- **Framework**: Node.js + Express + TypeScript
- **Database**: Production-ready DuckDB with smart R2 backup/restore
- **Payment Gateways**: Stripe and PayPal integration with webhook support
- **Authentication**: JWT-based with refresh tokens and session management
- **API**: RESTful API with 20+ comprehensive endpoints
- **Smart Backup**: Intelligent timestamp-based restore with CLI management tools

### Frontend  
- **Framework**: React 18 + TypeScript + Vite
- **Styling**: Tailwind CSS with custom SIREX branding
- **Payment UI**: Payment method management and transaction history components
- **State Management**: Context API with local storage
- **UI Components**: 14 custom components with responsive design

## ğŸ“¦ Installation

### Prerequisites
- Node.js 18+ 
- npm or yarn

### Setup

1. **Clone the repository**
   ```bash
   git clone <repository-url>
   cd sirex
   ```

2. **Install backend dependencies**
   ```bash
   npm install
   ```

3. **Install frontend dependencies**
   ```bash
   cd client
   npm install
   cd ..
   ```

4. **Environment setup**
   ```bash
   cp .env.example .env
   # Edit .env with your configuration (see Environment Variables section below)
   ```

5. **Database initialization**
   The database will automatically initialize on first startup with:
   - Complete RBF trading schema (12 tables)
   - Sample users, DROs, and investment data
   - Server startup tracking
   - Smart R2 backup restore (if backup newer than local)

6. **Start development servers**
   
   **Backend** (Terminal 1):
   ```bash
   npm run dev
   ```
   
   **Frontend** (Terminal 2):
   ```bash
   cd client
   npm run dev
   ```

## ğŸ”§ Development

### Backend Development
- **Start server**: `npm run dev`
- **Build**: `npm run build`
- **Lint**: `npm run lint`
- **Format**: `npm run format`

### Backup Management
- **Test R2 connection**: `node test-r2-connection.js`
- **Backup CLI**: `node backup-cli.js <command>`
- **List backups**: `node backup-cli.js list`
- **Create backup**: `node backup-cli.js backup`
- **Smart restore**: `node backup-cli.js restore`
- **Force restore**: `node backup-cli.js force-restore`
- **System status**: `node backup-cli.js status`

### Frontend Development
- **Start dev server**: `cd client && npm run dev`
- **Build**: `cd client && npm run build`
- **Preview**: `cd client && npm run preview`

## ğŸ“š API Documentation

### Authentication Endpoints
- `POST /api/auth/register` - User registration
- `POST /api/auth/login` - User login
- `POST /api/auth/logout` - User logout
- `GET /api/auth/me` - Get current user
- `POST /api/auth/refresh` - Refresh access token

### DRO Endpoints
- `GET /api/dro` - List DROs with filtering
- `POST /api/dro` - Create new DRO
- `GET /api/dro/:id` - Get DRO details
- `POST /api/dro/:id/invest` - Invest in DRO
- `GET /api/dro/my-dros` - Get user's DROs
- `GET /api/dro/my-investments` - Get user's investments
- `GET /api/dro/statistics` - Get platform statistics

### Revenue Endpoints
- `POST /api/revenue/report` - Report daily revenue
- `GET /api/revenue/my-payouts` - Get investor payouts
- `GET /api/revenue/performance` - Get investment performance
- `POST /api/revenue/calculate-returns` - Calculate projected returns

## ğŸ›  Backup Management CLI

SIREX includes a comprehensive backup management CLI for database operations:

### **Available Commands**
```bash
# List all available backups
node backup-cli.js list

# Create a manual backup
node backup-cli.js backup

# Smart restore (only if backup is newer than local)
node backup-cli.js restore

# Force restore latest backup (overwrites local)
node backup-cli.js force-restore

# Restore specific backup by ID
node backup-cli.js restore sirex-manual-2025-07-02T10-30-00.duckdb

# Show backup system status and health
node backup-cli.js status

# Clean up old backups based on retention policy
node backup-cli.js cleanup
```

### **Smart Restore Behavior**
The backup system intelligently decides when to restore:

- **Local DB newer than backup**: Keeps local version (preserves development work)
- **Backup newer than local DB**: Automatically restores from R2
- **No local DB**: Always restores from latest backup
- **Force restore**: Always overwrites local database (recovery scenarios)

```bash
$ node backup-cli.js status
```

- **MSME Dashboard**: Business funding management and revenue reporting

- **Enterprise Backup**: Intelligent R2 backup with smart restore capabilities

- **Payment Gateways**: Stripe and PayPal integration with webhook support
- **Authentication**: JWT-based with refresh tokens and session management
- **API**: RESTful API with 20+ comprehensive endpoints
- **Smart Backup**: Intelligent timestamp-based restore with CLI management tools

- **Framework**: React 18 + TypeScript + Vite

- **State Management**: Context API with local storage
- **UI Components**: 14 custom components with responsive design

## ğŸ“¦ Installation

- npm or yarn

### Setup

1. **Clone the repository**
   ```bash
   git clone <repository-url>
   cd sirex
   ```

   ```bash
   npm install
   ```

3. **Install frontend dependencies**
   ```bash
   cd client
   npm install
   cd ..
   ```

4. **Environment setup**
   ```bash
   cp .env.example .env

   ```

   ```bash

   ```
   
   **Frontend** (Terminal 2):
   ```bash
   cd client
   npm run dev
   ```

- **Build**: `npm run build`
- **Lint**: `npm run lint`
- **Format**: `npm run format`

- **Test R2 connection**: `node test-r2-connection.js`
- **Backup CLI**: `node backup-cli.js <command>`
- **Payment testing**: `node test-payments.js`
- **List backups**: `node backup-cli.js list`
- **Create backup**: `node backup-cli.js backup`
- **Smart restore**: `node backup-cli.js restore`
- **Force restore**: `node backup-cli.js force-restore`
- **System status**: `node backup-cli.js status`

- `POST /api/auth/register` - User registration

- `POST /api/auth/logout` - User logout
- `GET /api/auth/me` - Get current user
- `POST /api/auth/refresh` - Refresh access token

### DRO Endpoints
- `GET /api/dro` - List DROs with filtering
- `POST /api/dro` - Create new DRO

- `POST /api/dro/:id/invest` - Invest in DRO

- `GET /api/dro/my-investments` - Get user's investments
- `GET /api/dro/statistics` - Get platform statistics

- `GET /api/revenue/performance` - Get investment performance
- `POST /api/revenue/calculate-returns` - Calculate projected returns

SIREX includes a comprehensive backup management CLI for database operations:

### **Available Commands**
```bash
# List all available backups
node backup-cli.js list

# Create a manual backup
node backup-cli.js backup

# Smart restore (only if backup is newer than local)
node backup-cli.js restore

# Force restore latest backup (overwrites local)
node backup-cli.js force-restore

# Restore specific backup by ID
node backup-cli.js restore sirex-manual-2025-07-02T10-30-00.duckdb

# Show backup system status and health
node backup-cli.js status

# Clean up old backups based on retention policy
node backup-cli.js cleanup
```

### **Smart Restore Behavior**
The backup system intelligently decides when to restore:

- **Local DB newer than backup**: Keeps local version (preserves development work)
- **Backup newer than local DB**: Automatically restores from R2
- **No local DB**: Always restores from latest backup
- **Force restore**: Always overwrites local database (recovery scenarios)

- Configurable rate limiting

# Render.com Infrastructure as Code Configuration
# This file defines the complete SIREX deployment architecture
# Based on proven hesocial deployment patterns

services:
  # Backend API Service
  - type: web
    name: sirex-api
    runtime: node
    plan: free  # Start with free plan, upgrade as needed
    buildCommand: npm install && npm run build
    startCommand: npm start
    healthCheckPath: /health
    autoDeploy: true
    # Persistent disk for DuckDB storage
    disk:
      name: sirex-data
      mountPath: /opt/render/project/data
      sizeGB: 20
    envVars:
      # Core server configuration
      - key: NODE_ENV
        value: production
      - key: PORT
        value: 10000  # Use Render's standard port
      - key: DATABASE_PATH
        value: /opt/render/project/data/sirex.duckdb
      
      # CORS configuration - dynamic frontend URL
      - key: CORS_ORIGINS
        value: https://sirex-frontend.onrender.com,http://localhost:5173
      
      # Authentication secrets (auto-generated for security)
      - key: JWT_SECRET
        generateValue: true
      - key: JWT_REFRESH_SECRET
        generateValue: true
      - key: JWT_EXPIRES_IN
        value: 24h
      - key: JWT_REFRESH_EXPIRES_IN
        value: 7d
      - key: OTP_SECRET
        generateValue: true
      - key: OTP_EXPIRES_IN
        value: 300
      
      # R2 Backup System (Production Ready)
      - key: BACKUP_ENABLED
        value: true
      - key: CLOUDFLARE_R2_ACCESS_KEY_ID
        value: 6b4a6047504d1285d25bcdb1c88c6d79
      - key: CLOUDFLARE_R2_SECRET_ACCESS_KEY
        value: a475eb7ffe32983d8c3a1ea9006f353a25a7dce1050554a012af888cbb478f02
      - key: CLOUDFLARE_R2_BUCKET_NAME
        value: sirex
      - key: CLOUDFLARE_R2_ENDPOINT
        value: https://ed01ccea0b8ee7138058c4378cc83e54.r2.cloudflarestorage.com
      - key: CLOUDFLARE_R2_REGION
        value: auto
      - key: CLOUDFLARE_R2_BACKUP_PATH
        value: /backups/
      - key: BACKUP_RETENTION_DAYS
        value: 30
      
      # Rate limiting configuration
      - key: RATE_LIMIT_WINDOW_MINUTES
        value: 15
      - key: RATE_LIMIT_MAX_REQUESTS
        value: 1000
      
      # IMPORTANT: Add these manually in Render dashboard for security
      # Payment Processing (DO NOT COMMIT PRODUCTION KEYS)
      # - STRIPE_SECRET_KEY=sk_live_your_production_key
      # - STRIPE_PUBLISHABLE_KEY=pk_live_your_production_key  
      # - STRIPE_WEBHOOK_SECRET=whsec_your_webhook_secret
      # - PAYPAL_CLIENT_ID=your_production_client_id
      # - PAYPAL_CLIENT_SECRET=your_production_client_secret
      # - PAYPAL_MODE=production

  # Frontend Static Site
  - type: web
    name: sirex-frontend
    runtime: static
    buildCommand: cd client && npm install && npm run build
    staticPublishPath: ./client/dist
    autoDeploy: true
    # SPA routing configuration
    routes:
      - type: rewrite
        source: /*
        destination: /index.html
    envVars:
      # API configuration
      - key: VITE_API_URL
        value: https://sirex-api.onrender.com
      - key: VITE_ENVIRONMENT
        value: production
      
      # IMPORTANT: Add these manually in Render dashboard
      # Payment Processing (Public Keys)
      # - VITE_STRIPE_PUBLISHABLE_KEY=pk_live_your_production_key
      # - VITE_PAYPAL_CLIENT_ID=your_production_client_id

# Database configuration
databases: []

# Notes:
# 1. DuckDB runs in-process with the API service
# 2. Persistent disk provides 20GB storage for database
# 3. R2 backup system provides enterprise-grade data protection
# 4. Free plan to start, upgrade to Starter ($7/month) for better performance
# 5. SPA routing ensures frontend works with React Router
# 6. Environment variables use Render's auto-generation for security
